radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated up to 12 mm with significant appendiceal fat stranding and multiple appendicoliths. A loop of adjacent small bowel in the right lower quadrant shows a thickened wall, likely related to the adjacent inflammatory process. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits with no pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands show normal findings without focal lesions. The kidneys are normal with no hydronephrosis.
